titles.title: Authorizing the use of the Capitol Grounds for the National Book Festival.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Transportation and Infrastructure.
Committee Consideration and Mark-up Session Held.

committee.name: House Committee on Transportation and Infrastructure
House Committee on Transportation and Infrastructure

action.text: Reported by the Committee on Transportation. H. Rept. 107-400.

calendar.text: Placed on the House Calendar, Calendar No. 138.

action.text: Mrs. Capito moved to suspend the rules and agree to the resolution.
Considered under suspension of the rules.
DEBATE - The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H. Con. Res. 348.

vote.text: On motion to suspend the rules and agree to the resolution Agreed to by voice vote.

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
Received in the Senate and referred to the Committee on Rules and Administration.
Senate Committee on Rules and Administration discharged by Unanimous Consent.

vote.text: Resolution agreed to in Senate without amendment by Unanimous Consent.

action.text: Message on Senate action sent to the House.

bill.summary: 4/11/2002--Reported to House without amendment. Authorizes the Library of Congress, in cooperation with the First Lady, to sponsor a free public event, the National Book Festival on the Capitol grounds on September 21, 2002.
